item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Bypassing airport security via SQL injection (496 points | 122 comments)
2. Dawn of a new era in Search: Balancing innovation, competition, and public good (87 points | 17 comments)
3. OpenAI is good at unminifying code (712 points | 253 comments)
4. Raspberry Pi Pico does line rate 100M Ethernet (106 points | 16 comments)
5. Chrome Is Entrenching Third-Party Cookies That Will Mislead Users (127 points | 40 comments)
6. Launch HN: CodeViz (YC S24) – Visual maps of your codebase in VS Code (25 points | 6 comments)
7. Can solar costs keep shrinking? (115 points | 162 comments)
8. Launch HN: Patchwork (YC S24) – Automatically add structured logs to your code (48 points | 12 comments)
9. MindsDB (YC W20) Is Hiring ( | hide)
10. Judge Rules $400M Algorithmic System Illegally Denied People's Medicaid Benefits (96 points | 25 comments)
11. How I learned to stop worrying and love userspace networking (106 points | 21 comments)
12. Judges rule Big Tech's free ride on Section 230 is over (154 points | 171 comments)
13. 100M Token Context Windows (34 points | 2 comments)
14. Show HN: A discovery-focused search engine for Hacker News (34 points | 8 comments)
15. Show HN: Homemade Automated Solar Concentrator (202 points | 57 comments)
16. A Java Language Cumulative Feature Rollup (40 points | 25 comments)
17. Update on Llama adoption (119 points | 146 comments)
18. Web Design Museum (114 points | 27 comments)
19. Show HN: An open-source, local-first Webflow for your own app (112 points | 37 comments)
20. All Texts in Brooklyn (110 points | 39 comments)
21. GNU Screen 5.0 Released (143 points | 80 comments)
22. Air Con: $1697 for an on/off switch (1640 points | 424 comments)
23. Unified Grid: How We Re-Architected Slack for Our Largest Customers (23 points | 7 comments)
24. Airbnb banned me – how a ML model can misfire? (15 points | 2 comments)
25. Farewell Pandas, and thanks for all the fish (164 points | 100 comments)
26. X caught blocking links to NPR, claiming the news site may be 'unsafe' (42 points | 10 comments)
27. UK rail minister got engineer sacked for raising safety concerns (430 points | 218 comments)
28. New 2GB Raspberry Pi 5 has 33% smaller die, 30% idle power savings (167 points | 51 comments)
29. Japan's Real First Console? Bandai's TV Jack 5000 (35 points | 8 comments)
30. Recursive Macros with C++20 __VA_OPT__ (16 points | discuss)
